A: 1. Professor Wole Soyinka was the first African to win the Nobel Prize for _ (a) Peace (b) Literature (c) Science (d) Economics)
2. In what year did Wole Soyinka win the Nobel Prize for Literature? (a) 1986 (b) 1934 (c) 1960 (d) 1993)
3. Wole Soyinka was born in _ (a) Lagos (b) Ibadan (c) Abeokuta (d) Enugu)
4. Wole Soyinka was born on July 13, _ (a) 1986 (b) 1934 (c) 1960 (d) 1993)
5. Wole Soyinka is regarded as one of the best _, playwrights, and essay writers (a) poets (b) historians (c) politicians (d) activists)
6. Wole Soyinka played active roles in Nigeria's political history and its struggle with _ Colonization (a) French (b) German (c) British (d) Portuguese)
7. Chief Anthony Enahoro was born on July 22, _ (a) 1960 (b) 1923 (c) 1993 (d) 1986)
8. Chief Anthony Enahoro was a leading _ activist (a) pro-government (b) anti-colonial (c) pro-military (d) anti-democracy)
9. Who was the first Nigerian to move the motion for Nigeria's independence? (a) Wole Soyinka (b) MKO Abiola (c) Anthony Enahoro (d) Kudirat Abiola)
10. Nigeria gained its independence in the year _ (a) 1923 (b) 1960 (c) 1986 (d) 1993)
11. Alhaja Kudirat Abiola was the wife of late Chief _ Abiola (a) Olusegun (b) Moshood (c) Bola (d) Obafemi)
12. Chief MKO Abiola won the presidential election held on June _, 1993 (a) 10 (b) 12 (c) 14 (d) 16)
13. Alhaja Kudirat Abiola was killed in _ while her husband was in prison (a) 1993 (b) 1996 (c) 1986 (d) 1960)
14. Alhaja Kudirat Abiola fought for Nigeria to be free from _ rule (a) colonial (b) democratic (c) military (d) traditional)
15. A traditional ruler is primarily a _ leader (a) political (b) religious (c) cultural (d) economic)
16. Which of the following is NOT a title for a traditional ruler in Hausa land? (a) Emir (b) Lamido (c) Shehu (d) Oba)
17. The title 'Oba' is used for traditional rulers in _ land (a) Hausa (b) Igbo (c) Yoruba (d) Fulani)
18. Which of these titles belongs to Igbo land? (a) Emir (b) Lamido (c) Eze (d) Oba)
19. Traditional rulers are the custodians of _ and other domains (a) government (b) economy (c) culture (d) politics)
20. One role of traditional rulers is to settle _ and marriage quarrels (a) political (b) land (c) religious (d) business)
B: 1. Mention two types of traditional rulers found in Igbo land.
2. Name the Nigerian city where Professor Wole Soyinka was born.
3. What was Chief Anthony Enahoro's significant contribution related to Nigeria's independence?
4. Besides being a cultural leader, what else defines a traditional ruler according to the text?
5. State one reason why Alhaja Kudirat Abiola was killed.
6. List three roles of traditional rulers in the community.
7. What is the common title for traditional rulers in Yoruba land?
8. Provide the full name of MKO Abiola.
9. What year did Nigeria gain independence?
10. In what year was Chief Anthony Enahoro born?
answers_B: He moved the motion for Nigeria's independence
Head of an ethnic unit or clan whose title is recognized by government of the state
She wanted Nigeria to be free from military rule and fought for government of the people
Custodian of culture, settle land/marriage quarrels, support good leaders (any three)
answers_C: Beyond literature, he played active roles in Nigeria's political history and its struggle with British Colonization. He was imprisoned for many years, indicating his activism and commitment to political change.

Chief Anthony Enahoro was a leading anti-colonial and pro-democracy activist. His most significant contribution was being the first Nigerian to move the motion for Nigeria's independence, which was eventually granted in 1960. This act was pivotal in the country's self-governance.

Alhaja Kudirat Abiola played a crucial role in Nigeria's pro-democracy movement after the 1993 election, standing firm with her husband, Chief MKO Abiola, who was imprisoned. She actively fought for Nigeria to be free from military rule and advocated for a democratic 'government of the people, by the people and for the people'. Her assassination in 1996 underscored her unwavering commitment to democracy.

Traditional rulers serve as custodians of culture and other domains. Their responsibilities include settling land and marriage quarrels, supporting good leaders, educating people on their civic duties (like voting and paying taxes), punishing bad behavior, and ensuring people obey law and order within the community.

Both Chief Anthony Enahoro and Alhaja Kudirat Abiola were significant figures in Nigeria's political history, albeit in different eras. Enahoro was a prominent anti-colonial activist, instrumental in the struggle for independence by moving the motion for self-rule. Kudirat Abiola, on the other hand, was a pro-democracy activist who fought against military rule post-independence, advocating for the restoration of civilian governance after the annulled 1993 election. While Enahoro's struggle was for sovereignty from colonial powers, Kudirat's was for internal democratic governance.
